wikipedia_page.main: Kevin Greene  is a British classical archaeologist. He was a reader at Newcastle University until his retirement, and is now a visiting fellow in the School of History, Classics and Archaeology. He was elected a Fellow of the Society of Antiquaries of London in January 1981.His brother, J. Patrick Greene, is also an archaeologist.

response: Most Roman towns and cities had a forum and temples, as did the city of Rome itself. Aqueducts brought water to urban centres.Kevin Greene, "Technological Innovation and Economic Progress in the Ancient World: M.I. Finley Re-Considered", The Economic History Review, New Series, Vol. 53, No. 1. (February 2000), pp. 29–59 (39) Landlords generally resided in cities and left their estates in the care of farm managers.
Greene is the brother of fellow archaeologist Kevin Greene.
*Kevin Greene (rugby union), New Zealand rugby union player
Kevin Greene or Green may refer to:
*Kevin Greene (rugby union) (born 1949), New Zealand rugby union player
*Kevin Greene (American football) (1962–2020), American football player and coach
